internal.content: --- title: FAQ description: --- ## Is this extension avalible for Visual Studio? Unfortunately, Visual Studio does not allow external language imports in `tmLanguage` files. This would only allow syntax highlighting on Lava, and exclude all HTML tags. (As well as CSS, LESS, SQL, and C++). Due to this limitation, there are currently no plans to create a plugin for Visual Studio. ### But I really want Lava in Visual Studio! ![Both is good](https://media.giphy.com/media/h4ttKv8qdZEWI/giphy.gif) ![Both is good](/images/giphy.png) **Why not use both?** Use Visual Studio for writing C++ code, compiling, and running Rock... and use Visual Studio Code for Lava and frontend development. Visual Studio Code is easy to learn and awesome. ## What about ________? / Can I ________? Sure! Why not? Submit your suggestions, ideas and fixes on GitHub or to lava@garrett.io. _Please note that due to time constraints requests to port Lava for VSCode to another editor (Atom, Brackets, vim etc.) probably won't happen. Sorry!_ ## Is the Lava Extension for VSCode officially supported by Spark Development Network? No. This extension proudly part of the Rock RMS community as an open-source endevor. We accept bugs and feature requests through GitHub.

This would only allow syntax highlighting on Lava, and exclude all HTML tags. (As well as CSS, LESS, SQL, and C++). Due to this limitation, there are currently no plans to create a plugin for Visual Studio. ### But I really want Lava in Visual Studio! ![Both is good](https://media.giphy.com/media/h4ttKv8qdZEWI/giphy.gif) ![Both is good](/images/giphy.png) **Why not use both?** Use Visual Studio for writing C++ code, compiling, and running Rock... and use Visual Studio Code for Lava and frontend development. Visual Studio Code is easy to learn and awesome. ## What about ________? / Can I ________? Sure! Why not? Submit your suggestions, ideas and fixes on GitHub or to lava@garrett.io. _Please note that due to time constraints requests to port Lava for VSCode to another editor (Atom, Brackets, vim etc.) probably won't happen. Sorry!_ ## Is the Lava Extension for VSCode officially supported by Spark Development Network? No. This extension proudly part of the Rock RMS community as an open-source endevor. We accept bugs and feature requests through GitHub.
